name: Drake
politicalViews: Drake is a Democrat and has talked about being a big fan of America's last two Democratic presidents.
author: Tom Kershaw

content.text: Drake grew up between Vancouver, Canada and Memphis, Tennessee. His mother is Jewish and his father a southern black American, putting him squarely in Baptist country.
In Judaism, religious heritage is passed down through the mother and Drake has claimed being Jewish, making him the most famous black Jew since Lenny Kravitz.

content.sourceTitle: Rapper Drake Talks About His Bar Mitzvah
content.text: Drake even had a Bar Mitzvah and celebrates most major Jewish holidays with his mother.
He acknowledges that God and faith are important to him as well, saying:

content.sourceTitle: Westwood – Drake reveals his religious views
content.text: One thing I make sure I do is I always talk to the big guy upstairs. I always let him know what my purpose is on that stage. It's not to further my reputation….I want to make these people happy.

But wait, the list of successful Jewish rappers is only four people long: the three Beastie Boys and Matisyahu. Plus Drake is half-black, so what do you do when you are Jewish and you want to be a famous rapper? You say this:
At the end of the day, I consider myself a black man because I'm more immersed in black culture than any other.
Drake hasn't said much about politics except to profess his admiration for America's last two Democratic presidents. He has said:

content.sourceTitle: Drake Talks Presidents, Spending His Life with Nicki & The Fight With Chris Brown
content.text: One of my favorite pictures I have in my house is of me and Bill [Clinton] and I'm wearing a zebra Supreme jacket and he's wearing a suit. It's wild!

content.sourceTitle: Drake's Career Goal: Playing President Obama
content.text: I hope somebody makes a movie about Obama's life soon because I could play him. That's the goal. I watch all the addresses. Any time I see him on TV, I don't change the channel.
